bug.author: mufeili
bug.summary: node_type_subgraph fails when a graph does not have edges on the node type
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>ğŸ› Bug</denchmark-h>
As reported in <denchmark-link:https://discuss.dgl.ai/t/is-globalattentionpooling-supposed-to-work-with-heterographs/1642>discussion thread 1642</denchmark-link> , currently fails when a graph does not have edges among nodes of the type. A straightforward fix is to return a graph with no edges in the case. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
import dgl
g = dgl.heterograph({('a', 'a2b', 'b'): ([0, 1, 2], [0, 1, 0])}) g.node_type_subgraph('a') <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Return a graph with 3 nodes and 0 edges.

comments.comment: One issue is that DGL does not allow heterogeneous graphs without relations.
